analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'og min lha'i rgyal po'i khang bzangs na bzhugs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: bcom ldan 'das ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad bcom pas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad bcom pas so //

original: ldan pa ni yon tan drug dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: ldan pa ni yon tan drug dang ldan pas so //
translated: He is endowed with the six qualities.

original: 'das pa ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis ka la mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'das pa ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis ka la mi gnas pa ste /

analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa las kyang / tshu rol pha rol mtha' la min //
translated: The Abhisamayālaṅkāra says:🔽Not this shore, not the other shore,

original: de dag bar na mi gnas shing //
analyzed: de dag bar na mi gnas shing //
translated: not between the two,

original: dus rnams mnyam pa nyid shes pas //
analyzed: dus rnams mnyam pa nyid shes pas //
translated: knowing the equality of the three times,🔽he is the one who has gone beyond.

original: zhes bshad / yang /
analyzed: zhes bshad / yang /
translated: It also says:

original: 'khor ba dang ni mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang ni mya ngan 'das //
translated: Saṃsāra and nirvāṇa

original: 'di gnyis yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: 'di gnyis yod pa ma yin te //
translated: these two do not exist.

original: 'khor ba yongs su shes pa la //
analyzed: 'khor ba yongs su shes pa la //
translated: When saṃsāra is fully understood,

original: mya ngan 'das zhes brjod pa yin //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das zhes brjod pa yin //
translated: it is called nirvāṇa.

original: zhes gsungs pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: Therefore, he is the Bhagavān.

original: kha cig ni /
analyzed: kha cig ni /
translated: Some say:🔽Because he has awakened from the sleep of ignorance

original: ma rig gnyid las sangs phyir dang // blo rgyas phyir na sangs rgyas zhes pa dang yang @174b mtshungs so //
analyzed: ma rig gnyid las sangs phyir dang // blo rgyas phyir na sangs rgyas zhes pa dang yang @174b mtshungs so //
translated: and because his mind has expanded, he is the Buddha.

original: yang na bcom pa ni bdud la sogs pa bzhi bcom pa'am /
analyzed: yang na bcom pa ni bdud la sogs pa bzhi bcom pa'am /
translated: Alternatively, he is the conqueror because he has conquered the four māras and so on.

original: ldan pa yon tan dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: ldan pa yon tan dang ldan pas so //
translated: It is endowed with the qualities of the Buddha.

original: des ston pa bshad nas gnas ni 'og min ces pas te /
analyzed: des ston pa bshad nas gnas ni 'og min ces pas te /
translated: Having explained the teacher, the place is described by “in Akaniṣṭha.”

original: 'og min gyi gnas stug po bkod pa'i zhing khams de las lha'i rgyal po rtog pa dang bral ba'i lha bzhugs pas na de'i khang bzangs so //
analyzed: 'og min gyi gnas stug po bkod pa'i zhing khams de las lha'i rgyal po rtog pa dang bral ba'i lha bzhugs pas na de'i khang bzangs so //
translated: That place is the realm of Akaniṣṭha Ghanavyūha, and because the king of gods, who is free from conceptual thought, resides there, it is his palace.

original: bzhugs pa'i spyod lam gyis so //
analyzed: bzhugs pa'i spyod lam gyis so //
translated: It is the place where he resides.

original: yang na mnyam par gzhag pas zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: yang na mnyam par gzhag pas zhes 'chad do //
translated: Or it is explained as “equipoise.”

original: chos ston pa dang rnam par dkar ba'i chos gzhan ston pa la zhu ba po rten gyi gang zag bstan pa'i phyir yang de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i snying pos so ;
analyzed: chos ston pa dang rnam par dkar ba'i chos gzhan ston pa la zhu ba po rten gyi gang zag bstan pa'i phyir yang de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i snying pos so ;
translated: In order to teach the person who is the support of the teaching of the Dharma and the teaching of other pure Dharmas, it says “at that time the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ākāśagarbha.”

original: / de la ston pa dag pa bcom ldan 'das longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang ldan pas gnas 'og min du zhu ba po dag pa byang chub sems dpas zhus pas de kho na nyid zung 'jug la sogs pa sngags kyi don du 'grel ba yang yod do
analyzed: / de la ston pa dag pa bcom ldan 'das longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang ldan pas gnas 'og min du zhu ba po dag pa byang chub sems dpas zhus pas de kho na nyid zung 'jug la sogs pa sngags kyi don du 'grel ba yang yod do
translated: There, the pure teacher, the Bhagavān, who possesses the saṃbhogakāya, in the place of Akaniṣṭha, is requested by the pure bodhisattva, and he explains the meaning of mantra, such as the suchness of union.

original: // zhus pa'i tshig ni btsun pa bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' nam 'chi ka ma'i sems ji ltar blta bar bgyi zhes gsol pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: // zhus pa'i tshig ni btsun pa bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' nam 'chi ka ma'i sems ji ltar blta bar bgyi zhes gsol pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The words of the question are: “The bodhisattva asked the Bhagavat, ‘How should one view the mind at the time of death?’”

original: de la bcom ldan 'das la sogs pa ha cang spros pas chog go //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das la sogs pa ha cang spros pas chog go //
translated: It is sufficient to have mentioned the Bhagavat, etc.🔽As for “bodhisattva,”

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa ni //
translated: it is explained:

original: byang chub nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: byang chub nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: Enlightenment has the characteristic of space,

original: rtog pa thams cad spangs phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad spangs phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from all conceptualization.

original: zhes bshad pa nas /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa nas /
translated: And from:🔽Great renunciation, great mind, great power,🔽Embarking on the supreme vehicle of the victors,

original: gtong ba che dang blo che ba dang mthu che dang // rgyal ba rnams kyi theg chen mchog la zhugs pa dang // go cha chen po bgos shing bdud kyi sgyu 'dul ba //
analyzed: gtong ba che dang blo che ba dang mthu che dang // rgyal ba rnams kyi theg chen mchog la zhugs pa dang // go cha chen po bgos shing bdud kyi sgyu 'dul ba //
translated: Wearing the great armor, taming the illusions of Mara,

original: de yi phyir na sems dpa' che zhes rab tu brjod //
analyzed: de yi phyir na sems dpa' che zhes rab tu brjod //
translated: Therefore, it is well known as the great being.

original: ces gsungs pa sa chen po'i don yang de yin te /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa sa chen po'i don yang de yin te /
translated: Thus, it is also explained as the meaning of “great earth,”

original: sems can gyi don la dpa' bas so zhes kyang bshad /
analyzed: sems can gyi don la dpa' bas so zhes kyang bshad /
translated: because it is heroic in the welfare of sentient beings.

original: 'phags pa ni las dang nyon mongs pa las ring du gyur bas 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa ni las dang nyon mongs pa las ring du gyur bas 'phags pa ste /
translated: The noble ones are called noble because they have gone far from karma and afflictions.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rtsibs bcom pas so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rtsibs bcom pas so //
translated: They have destroyed the spokes of dependent origination.

original: des na aarhata kyi sgra las bshad do //
analyzed: des na aarhata kyi sgra las bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the term arhat is explained from the root arh.

original: ming gis mtshon nas nam mkha'i snying pos chos rtags kyi phyag rgya bzhi yis rgyas thebs pa'i sems can gyi nam 'chi ba ste /
analyzed: ming gis mtshon nas nam mkha'i snying pos chos rtags kyi phyag rgya bzhi yis rgyas thebs pa'i sems can gyi nam 'chi ba ste /
translated: Having indicated by name, Akasagarbha asks about the sentient beings who are sealed with the four dharma mudras, When do they die?

original: mi rtag par gyur pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis su 'khor ba'i sems can de mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag par gyur pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis su 'khor ba'i sems can de mi rtag pa ste /
translated: Since they are impermanent, sentient beings who cycle in the twelve links of dependent origination are impermanent.

original: srog 'joms pa 'chi ka ma rgyal po la gdams pa'i mdo la sogs pa las 'byung ba'i dus su sems ji ltar blta bar bya @175a * //🔽zhes zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: srog 'joms pa 'chi ka ma rgyal po la gdams pa'i mdo la sogs pa las 'byung ba'i dus su sems ji ltar blta bar bya @175a * // zhes zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: At the time of death, when life is destroyed, how should the mind be viewed?🔽 The Bhagavan replied, Akasagarbha, your question to me is excellent.

original: nam mkha'i snying po khyod kyis nga la zhus pa de legs te yid dang ba'i sgo nas nyon cig /
analyzed: nam mkha'i snying po khyod kyis nga la zhus pa de legs te yid dang ba'i sgo nas nyon cig /
translated: Listen with a clear mind.

original: ngas legs par bshad par bya yi zhes bka' stsal te /
analyzed: ngas legs par bshad par bya yi zhes bka' stsal te /
translated: I will explain it well.

original: thog ma nas rang gi sems ma rtogs pas 'khor bar 'khyam pas na de la skye rga na 'chi rnams dang bral ba mi srid do //
analyzed: thog ma nas rang gi sems ma rtogs pas 'khor bar 'khyam pas na de la skye rga na 'chi rnams dang bral ba mi srid do //
translated: Since from the beginning one wanders in cyclic existence due to not realizing one's own mind, it is impossible to be free from birth, aging, sickness, and death.

original: rten cing 'brel ba'i chos las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel ba'i chos las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not transcend dependent origination.

original: de'i phyir na skye rga na 'chi dang 'bral bar 'dod pas 'da' ka'i ye shes lhun gyis grub pa spros pa dang bral ba de bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na skye rga na 'chi dang 'bral bar 'dod pas 'da' ka'i ye shes lhun gyis grub pa spros pa dang bral ba de bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those who wish to be free from birth, aging, sickness, and death should meditate on the spontaneous, unelaborated wisdom of the moment of death.

original: dus las mtshon nas nam 'chi ka ma'i bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dus las mtshon nas nam 'chi ka ma'i bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the moment of death by illustrating it with time.

original: de yang / bya ba sgrub par byed pa la //
analyzed: de yang / bya ba sgrub par byed pa la //
translated: Moreover, since one accomplishes it with diligence in accomplishing activities,

original: brtun pas 'grub pas skyes bu dang // mgo la me shor ji bzhin no //
analyzed: brtun pas 'grub pas skyes bu dang // mgo la me shor ji bzhin no //
translated: it is like when the head is on fire.

original: zhes gsungs pas rab tu bsgom par bya'o zhes gang bsgom pa'i dngos po dang bcas pas bstan nas /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas rab tu bsgom par bya'o zhes gang bsgom pa'i dngos po dang bcas pas bstan nas /
translated: Since it is explained along with the entity of meditation,

original: de ni de dag gi ngo bo nyid spros pa dang bcas pa 'chad par 'dod nas dri bas 'da' ka ma'i ye shes zhes bya ba de gang zhe na zhes dris pa dang / de la zhes yul du byas te ye shes bsgom pa de'o //
analyzed: de ni de dag gi ngo bo nyid spros pa dang bcas pa 'chad par 'dod nas dri bas 'da' ka ma'i ye shes zhes bya ba de gang zhe na zhes dris pa dang / de la zhes yul du byas te ye shes bsgom pa de'o //
translated: Since he wishes to explain their essential nature with elaboration, he asks, “What is that called ‘transcendent wisdom’?”

original: ji ltar bsgom na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgom na /
translated: How is it cultivated?

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pas na dngos po med pa'i 'du shes rab tu bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pas na dngos po med pa'i 'du shes rab tu bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Since all phenomena are pure by nature, one should cultivate the perception of their nonexistence.”

original: chos thams cad ces pa ni grangs dang dngos po'i thams cad de ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces pa ni grangs dang dngos po'i thams cad de ma lus pa'o //
translated: “All phenomena” refers to all things and all enumerations, without exception.

original: chos ni mtshan nyid 'dzin phyir chos zhes bya zhes gsungs pas khyab par bya ba'i khyab bya la ma khyab ba med pas na chos thams cad rang bzhin nam ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa ste ;
analyzed: chos ni mtshan nyid 'dzin phyir chos zhes bya zhes gsungs pas khyab par bya ba'i khyab bya la ma khyab ba med pas na chos thams cad rang bzhin nam ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa ste ;
translated: Since it is said, “Phenomena are called phenomena because they hold their own characteristics,” there is nothing that is not pervaded by the pervasion of all phenomena being pure by nature or essence.

original: dkon brtsegs las /
analyzed: dkon brtsegs las /
translated: The Heap of Jewels says:

original: chos rnams thams cad dag pa ste //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad dag pa ste //
translated: All phenomena are pure.

original: nyes skyon la sogs dmigs pa med //
analyzed: nyes skyon la sogs dmigs pa med //
translated: Faults and so on are not observed.

original: de bas rang bzhin ngo bo la //
analyzed: de bas rang bzhin ngo bo la //
translated: How could there be any apprehension of entities and so on

original: dngos sogs 'dzin pa ga la srid //
analyzed: dngos sogs 'dzin pa ga la srid //
translated: With respect to the nature of the essence?

original: ces gsungs pas na rang dang spyi'i chos de thams cad dngos po med pas don ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa brjod du med pa'i gsal snang ngo bo nyid las 'das par bshad do //
analyzed: ces gsungs pas na rang dang spyi'i chos de thams cad dngos po med pas don ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa brjod du med pa'i gsal snang ngo bo nyid las 'das par bshad do //
translated: Thus, since all of those phenomena, general and particular, are not entities, the meaning is explained as being empty of an essence, an inexpressible clear appearance that transcends essence.

original: de'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore,

original: nam mkha' mthong zhes sems can tshig tu rab brjod pa //
analyzed: nam mkha' mthong zhes sems can tshig tu rab brjod pa //
translated: Sentient beings say, “I see space.”

original: nam mkha' ji ltar mthong ste don 'di brtag par bgyi //
analyzed: nam mkha' ji ltar mthong ste don 'di brtag par bgyi //
translated: How is space seen? This meaning should be analyzed.

original: de ltar chos mthong ba yang de bzhin gshegs pas bstan //
analyzed: de ltar chos mthong ba yang de bzhin gshegs pas bstan //
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata taught that seeing phenomena is also like that.

original: ces dpe @175b don sbyar ba yang yang bshad do //
analyzed: ces dpe @175b don sbyar ba yang yang bshad do //
translated: The application of the example and meaning is explained again and again.

original: des dngos po don dam mtshan nyid la gnas pa bshad nas gang zag la ltos pa bstan pa'i phyir kun rdzob rgya chad med pa bstan pa'i phyir kun rdzob la rgyu 'bras la gnod pa med pa spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des dngos po don dam mtshan nyid la gnas pa bshad nas gang zag la ltos pa bstan pa'i phyir kun rdzob rgya chad med pa bstan pa'i phyir kun rdzob la rgyu 'bras la gnod pa med pa spang ba'i phyir /
translated: Having explained the abiding of the ultimate characteristics of entities, in order to teach the dependence on the person, in order to teach the unrestrained relative, and in order to abandon the fault that cause and effect are not possible in the relative,

original: chos thams cad byang chub sems su 'dus pas na snying rje chen po'i 'du shes rab tu bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chos thams cad byang chub sems su 'dus pas na snying rje chen po'i 'du shes rab tu bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Since all phenomena are included in awakened mind, cultivate the perception of great compassion.

original: gang zag shes rab shas chung ba blo tha ma la bslab pa rnams la ltos nas snang ba 'di med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zag shes rab shas chung ba blo tha ma la bslab pa rnams la ltos nas snang ba 'di med pa ma yin te /
translated: For those of lesser acumen, those with the average degree of acumen, the perception of this is not absent, but is taught in terms of the training.

original: chos thams cad kyi rtsa ba gzhan las mi gnod pas khyad par du bya bar theg pa rnam gnyis kyang khas len par snang na de las 'di rab tu mi gnas pa don gsal stong par gnas pas na /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rtsa ba gzhan las mi gnod pas khyad par du bya bar theg pa rnam gnyis kyang khas len par snang na de las 'di rab tu mi gnas pa don gsal stong par gnas pas na /
translated: Since the root of all phenomena is not invalidated by anything else, it is the special basis for the two spiritual approaches, which are accepted as being included within it.

original: stong pa kho na yang min te /
analyzed: stong pa kho na yang min te /
translated: Since this is not the case for those two approaches, it is not simply emptiness.🔽It is explained:

original: stong nyid snying rje'i snying bo can //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje'i snying bo can //
translated: Emptiness is the essence of compassion.

original: zhes bshad / theg pa gong ma rnams mi gnod pa tsam yod pas min te /
analyzed: zhes bshad / theg pa gong ma rnams mi gnod pa tsam yod pas min te /
translated: It is not that the higher spiritual approaches are not included, but that they are included in a way that is not invalidated.

original: phan 'dogs dang bcas pas gnas pas theg pa rin chen gsal las kyang /
analyzed: phan 'dogs dang bcas pas gnas pas theg pa rin chen gsal las kyang /
translated: Since they are included in a way that is beneficial, the Illuminating Jewel of the Spiritual Approaches states:

original: byang chub sems la rab gnas pa //
analyzed: byang chub sems la rab gnas pa //
translated: Those who abide in the awakened mind

original: stong nyid la sogs thag mi ring //
analyzed: stong nyid la sogs thag mi ring //
translated: are not far from emptiness and so forth.

original: thabs dang shes rab zung 'brel na //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab zung 'brel na //
translated: If method and wisdom are united,

original: spyod tshul gang ltar gnas kyang ste //
analyzed: spyod tshul gang ltar gnas kyang ste //
translated: then no matter what way of conduct one abides in,

original: kho na nyid la 'gyur ba med //
analyzed: kho na nyid la 'gyur ba med //
translated: there is no change in reality.

original: ces gsungs pa dang / dbu ma de kho na nyid las /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa dang / dbu ma de kho na nyid las /
translated: And the Madhyamaka tattva says:

original: snying rje'i yul du sems can te //
analyzed: snying rje'i yul du sems can te //
translated: Sentient beings are the object of compassion,

original: de rgu byang chub sems las byung //
analyzed: de rgu byang chub sems las byung //
translated: and they are helped by the spirit of enlightenment.🔽Thus there is no contradiction.

original: zhes pas na 'gal ba med pa dang // bslab btus las kyang /
analyzed: zhes pas na 'gal ba med pa dang // bslab btus las kyang /
translated: And the Siksasamuccaya says:

original: byang chub tu yang blo brtan bya //
analyzed: byang chub tu yang blo brtan bya //
translated: One should also stabilize the mind in enlightenment.

original: zhes gsungs pas na gang mtha' gnyis su mi ltung bar bya ba'i ched du gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas na gang mtha' gnyis su mi ltung bar bya ba'i ched du gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is taught for the purpose of not falling into the two extremes.

original: de'i phyir na sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyang mtha' gnyis las ma los pas 'jug par bya zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir na sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyang mtha' gnyis las ma los pas 'jug par bya zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore the earlier masters also said that one should engage in the middle way that avoids the two extremes.

original: des na tshig don ni rtogs sla bas ha cang ma spros so //
analyzed: des na tshig don ni rtogs sla bas ha cang ma spros so //
translated: Therefore the words and their meaning are easy to understand, so I have not elaborated too much.

original: des chad lta la sogs pa rnam par bkag nas /
analyzed: des chad lta la sogs pa rnam par bkag nas /
translated: Having thus refuted nihilism and so forth,

original: da ni dngos kyi don snang ba thams cad kyi rigs don la bsgom pa 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: da ni dngos kyi don snang ba thams cad kyi rigs don la bsgom pa 'chad pa ni /
translated: now I will explain the meditation on the meaning of the type of all appearances, the actual point.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bas na mi dmigs pa'i 'du shes bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bas na mi dmigs pa'i 'du shes bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: Since all phenomena are naturally luminous, one should cultivate the perception of non-apprehension.

original: de yang rang la snang ba'i chos 'di thams cad ngo bo nyid la rtog pa dang bral bas sgrib byed med de /
analyzed: de yang rang la snang ba'i chos 'di thams cad ngo bo nyid la rtog pa dang bral bas sgrib byed med de /
translated: Moreover, all these phenomena that appear to oneself are free from conceptualization in their very essence, and so there is no obscuring.

original: dper na nam mkha' rang bzhin gyis dag pa bzhin no //🔽de bas na chos @176a * //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' rang bzhin gyis dag pa bzhin no // de bas na chos @176a * //
translated: For example, it is like space, which is pure by nature.

original: thams cad 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are luminous.

original: dper na nyi ma'i 'od zer bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nyi ma'i 'od zer bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the sun's rays.

original: de la kha cig na re khyed kyi dpe la gnod pa yod de /
analyzed: de la kha cig na re khyed kyi dpe la gnod pa yod de /
translated: In this regard, someone might say, “There is a fault in your example.

original: nam mkha' dag pa la nyi ma snang ba la 'od zer gsal kyang sprin la sogs pas sgrib g-yogs yod na mi gsal ba bzhin dpe ma grub ste ;
analyzed: nam mkha' dag pa la nyi ma snang ba la 'od zer gsal kyang sprin la sogs pas sgrib g-yogs yod na mi gsal ba bzhin dpe ma grub ste ;
translated: For example, even though the sun shines in a pure sky, its rays are clear, but if there is an obscuring cloud, etc., it is not clear. The example is not established,

original: gnod do zhe na /
analyzed: gnod do zhe na /
translated: and it is faulty.”

original: des mi gnod de /
analyzed: des mi gnod de /
translated: That does not fault it.

original: nyi ma'i 'od zer la ni nam yang sgrib g-yogs yod pas mi gsal ba dang med pas gsal ba la sogs pa dang ste spyi sems can gyi snang ba la snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od zer la ni nam yang sgrib g-yogs yod pas mi gsal ba dang med pas gsal ba la sogs pa dang ste spyi sems can gyi snang ba la snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The sun’s rays are never obscured, and so they are clear, and never not obscured, and so they are clear.

original: des na chos rnams kyi rang bzhin la 'od gsal ba sgrib pa med pa dang / mi gsal ba sgrib bcas med pas na sems can gyi snang ba la yin te /
analyzed: des na chos rnams kyi rang bzhin la 'od gsal ba sgrib pa med pa dang / mi gsal ba sgrib bcas med pas na sems can gyi snang ba la yin te /
translated: Therefore, the nature of phenomena is clear light, without obscuration, and not clear light, with obscuration.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa la sogs pa gsal bas kyang chos kyi ngo bo nyid la gsal ba med la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa la sogs pa gsal bas kyang chos kyi ngo bo nyid la gsal ba med la /
translated: Because of the obscurations of afflictions and so on, the nature of phenomena is not clear.

original: sgrib pas mi gsal ba med par /
analyzed: sgrib pas mi gsal ba med par /
translated: And because of the obscurations, it is not not clear.

original: yang dbu ma rigs pa brtag pa las /
analyzed: yang dbu ma rigs pa brtag pa las /
translated: The Madhyamaka Rational System says:

original: chos kyi dngos po gnas pa la //
analyzed: chos kyi dngos po gnas pa la //
translated: In the abiding reality of phenomena,

original: dus dang che chung gsal mi gsal //
analyzed: dus dang che chung gsal mi gsal //
translated: Time, size, clarity, and unclarity

original: 'byed par gyur pa'i gang zag de /
analyzed: 'byed par gyur pa'i gang zag de /
translated: Are distinctions made by persons.

original: nga yi 'khor du ji ste rigs //🔽de bas 'od gsal stong ba yin //
analyzed: nga yi 'khor du ji ste rigs // de bas 'od gsal stong ba yin //
translated: How could they be suitable in my retinue?

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is clear light and empty.

original: des na dngos po la dmigs pa med pa snang tsam nyid na stong pas na yul mi dmigs te 'dzin pa'i shes pa mi dmigs pas na dmigs bya dmigs byed gnyi ga la /
analyzed: des na dngos po la dmigs pa med pa snang tsam nyid na stong pas na yul mi dmigs te 'dzin pa'i shes pa mi dmigs pas na dmigs bya dmigs byed gnyi ga la /
translated: Therefore, since things are not perceived, since they are empty in being mere appearances, the object is not perceived. And since the perceiving consciousness is not perceived either, neither the object perceived nor the perceiving subject is perceived.🔽

original: grub pa gnas med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i 'du shes rab tu bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: grub pa gnas med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i 'du shes rab tu bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since things are not observed, since they are empty just in their mere appearance, the object is not observed. Since the apprehending consciousness is not observed, one should cultivate the notion of non-observation, because both the observed object and the observing subject are not established.

original: de yang skabs kyi tshig gi bsgom pa'i dngos po des 'chi ka ma'i tshe zhes thams cad la sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang skabs kyi tshig gi bsgom pa'i dngos po des 'chi ka ma'i tshe zhes thams cad la sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should understand that the phrase “at the time of death” in this context is to be applied to all [the above practices].

original: 'o na gal te 'chi kha kho na bsgom gyi gzhan du ma yin nam zhe na //
analyzed: 'o na gal te 'chi kha kho na bsgom gyi gzhan du ma yin nam zhe na //
translated: If one cultivates [this practice] only at the time of death, not at other times,

original: de'i rgol ba la skabs med de /
analyzed: de'i rgol ba la skabs med de /
translated: then there is no opportunity for that objection.

original: 'chi kha zhes pa ni dngos po dad dus la nges par gzung ba med de /
analyzed: 'chi kha zhes pa ni dngos po dad dus la nges par gzung ba med de /
translated: As for “the time of death,” it does not necessarily refer to a specific time.

original: dbu ma sgrub pa chen po las //
analyzed: dbu ma sgrub pa chen po las //
translated: As it says in the Great Madhyamaka Sādhana:

original: mi rtag 'gyur la gnas dang dus //
analyzed: mi rtag 'gyur la gnas dang dus //
translated: Permanence, change, abiding, and time—

original: gang 'di yod par ngas ma mthong //
analyzed: gang 'di yod par ngas ma mthong //
translated: I do not see any of these as existent.

original: de bas skyes pa kho na nas //
analyzed: de bas skyes pa kho na nas //
translated: Therefore, from the very moment of birth,

original: 'chi bdag kha na gnas pa yin //
analyzed: 'chi bdag kha na gnas pa yin //
translated: one is in the mouth of the Lord of Death.

original: zhes slob dpon klu sgrub kyis gsungs pa dang / nam zhig sangs rgyas ma gtogs par //
analyzed: zhes slob dpon klu sgrub kyis gsungs pa dang / nam zhig sangs rgyas ma gtogs par //
translated: When one is not a Buddha,

original: mi rtag la sogs gnas pa yin //
analyzed: mi rtag la sogs gnas pa yin //
translated: one abides in impermanence and so on.🔽And:🔽Since the time of death is uncertain,🔽one should strive for liberation with great perseverance.

original: zhes pa dang / yang slob dpon klu sgrub kyis rang la 'chi ba'i dus nges pa med pas thar pa'i don du 'bad pa ni brtson 'grus @176b chen po dang ldan pas bya'o zhes gsungs pas na 'chi kha ma zhes rgyal po la gdams pa'i mdo sogs ni dpe tsam yin te
analyzed: zhes pa dang / yang slob dpon klu sgrub kyis rang la 'chi ba'i dus nges pa med pas thar pa'i don du 'bad pa ni brtson 'grus @176b chen po dang ldan pas bya'o zhes gsungs pas na 'chi kha ma zhes rgyal po la gdams pa'i mdo sogs ni dpe tsam yin te
translated: Therefore, the Sutra Advice to the King and so on are merely examples,

original: skyes nas 'chi kha ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: skyes nas 'chi kha ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'chad do //
translated: because they are not the time of death after birth.

original: kha cig ni rgol ba la 'dod pas sgrub pa yang snang ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni rgol ba la 'dod pas sgrub pa yang snang ste /
translated: Some argue that this is a proof by desire,

original: bsgom pa la 'chi khar bsgom la yang rtog pa med ces 'chad do //
analyzed: bsgom pa la 'chi khar bsgom la yang rtog pa med ces 'chad do //
translated: and explain that at the time of death, there is no thought in meditation.

original: 'di ni ngan te 'chi kha'i gnas skabs na sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la sogs pas gzir bas skabs su sems la ting nge 'dzin mi skye ba med /
analyzed: 'di ni ngan te 'chi kha'i gnas skabs na sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la sogs pas gzir bas skabs su sems la ting nge 'dzin mi skye ba med /
translated: This is bad, because in the state of death, the mind is oppressed by the feeling of suffering and so on, so there is no occasion for concentration to arise.

original: theg pa che la zhugs pa ste //
analyzed: theg pa che la zhugs pa ste //
translated: One who has entered the Great Vehicle

original: ji srid gson par las grub nas //
analyzed: ji srid gson par las grub nas //
translated: As long as one lives, one accomplishes karma,

original: 'chi ba'i dus su dga' bas 'gro //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus su dga' bas 'gro //
translated: and at the time of death, one goes with joy.

original: zhes gsungs pas na 'chi kha ma ni skyes tsam nyid na 'chi kha mar gnas pa yin no zhes 'chad pa bzang ngo //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas na 'chi kha ma ni skyes tsam nyid na 'chi kha mar gnas pa yin no zhes 'chad pa bzang ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is excellent to explain that the moment of death is the state of being at the moment of death, just as soon as one is born.

original: rang ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'am /
analyzed: rang ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa 'am /
translated: One’s own nature is empty.

original: gnas pa'i don bshad nas re zhig phyi nang gi nye du dang nor rdzas la sogs pa la yang chags par mi rigs par ston pa ni /
analyzed: gnas pa'i don bshad nas re zhig phyi nang gi nye du dang nor rdzas la sogs pa la yang chags par mi rigs par ston pa ni /
translated: Having explained the meaning of abiding, now, in order to show that it is not reasonable to be attached to external and internal relatives, wealth, possessions, and so on,

original: dngos po thams cad mi rtag pas na ci la yang mi chags pa'i 'du shes rab tu bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad mi rtag pas na ci la yang mi chags pa'i 'du shes rab tu bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Since all things are impermanent, one should cultivate the discernment of not being attached to anything.”

analyzed: de la dngos po ni phyir brten par snang ba thams cad dang / nang g-yo bar snang ba snod bcud thams cad kyang mi rtag ste /
translated: In that regard, all things are impermanent, all that appears externally as support and all that appears internally as movement.

original: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa //
translated: It is said, “All conditioned things are impermanent,”

original: zhes pa dang / dngos po la sogs rtag par ngas ma mthong //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / dngos po la sogs rtag par ngas ma mthong //
translated: and “I have never seen a thing that is permanent.”

analyzed: de bas chags pa'i blo ma 'jug / ces pa dang / skabs dang sbyar na dbu ma rigs pa brtag pa las / gang la chags pa de nyid spangs /
translated: And in the context of the above, the Madhyamaka Rational System states:🔽That very thing to which one is attached should be abandoned,

original: des ni 'ching bar 'gyur ba'i phyir //🔽khyad par bu dang bu mo sogs //
analyzed: des ni 'ching bar 'gyur ba'i phyir // khyad par bu dang bu mo sogs //
translated: because by it one is bound.🔽In particular, it is proper to make into an object of abandonment

analyzed: spang ba'i yul du bya bar rigs // zhes bshad pas na /
translated: sons, daughters, and so forth.

original: gnas skabs brje bas na de la chags pa'i gnas med pas nam yang chags par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs brje bas na de la chags pa'i gnas med pas nam yang chags par mi bya ste /
translated: Thus, since there is no basis for attachment to that which is exchanged in the context of impermanence, one should never be attached.

original: de'i gnas skabs ni mi rtag pa'i rnam par ngo bo nyid la gnas pas bya ba med de /
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs ni mi rtag pa'i rnam par ngo bo nyid la gnas pas bya ba med de /
translated: The context of impermanence is the nature of things that is based on impermanence, and so there is no action.

original: des na chags pa med de /
analyzed: des na chags pa med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no attachment.

original: nang sems can dang / phyi yo byad la yang chags pa med par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: nang sems can dang / phyi yo byad la yang chags pa med par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the teaching is that one should be without attachment to inner sentient beings and outer objects.

original: de yang blo rab 'bring gi bye brag gis gzhan la btang ba mi dmigs pas zin pa'i ma chags pa dang / dngos po la ma chags kyang de'i 'dod pa'i yul la chags pa dang ma chags pa 'dra yang dmigs med gyi rgyas ma thebs pas ma bral ba'i blo can gyis rim ba bzhin blo la snang @177a * //

translated: The generosity of those with inferior intelligence is not the principal generosity, because they are not focused on things or others, but they are focused on the objects of their desire.🔽The generosity of those with superior intelligence is the principal generosity, because they are not separated from wisdom, since they are not focused on anything.🔽The generosity of those with middling intelligence is not the principal generosity, because they are not focused on things, but they are focused on others.🔽The generosity of those with inferior intelligence is not the principal generosity, because they are not focused on things or others, but they are focused on the objects of their desire.

analyzed: de las gzhan pa bstan bcos rnam gnyis la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni btang ba dang ldan pa'i chags pa med pa ma yin pa'i phyir na / slob dpon klu sgrub kyis /
translated: The generosity of those with middling intelligence is not the principal generosity, because they are not focused on things, but they are focused on others.

original: chags pa'i yul la dngos med par //
analyzed: chags pa'i yul la dngos med par //

analyzed: de la chags pa skye ba de //
translated: Attachment to that arises.

original: rigs sam gal te ri bong rva //
analyzed: rigs sam gal te ri bong rva //
translated: If it is a rabbit horn,

original: de la'ang chags pa skye bar rigs //
analyzed: de la'ang chags pa skye bar rigs //
translated: it is reasonable that attachment to that arises.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang mthun pas na chags pa med de mi rtag par gnas pas zhes skabs don dang yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang mthun pas na chags pa med de mi rtag par gnas pas zhes skabs don dang yang sbyar ro //
translated: Since this accords with the statement, there is no attachment. Since it abides as impermanent, it is also applied to the present context.

original: 'du shes ni de la thabs kyis gnas pas na bsgom pa'am de la dngos po de gnas pas na de'i khyab pa sgrub pa'i tshul du bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'du shes ni de la thabs kyis gnas pas na bsgom pa'am de la dngos po de gnas pas na de'i khyab pa sgrub pa'i tshul du bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Since discernment abides there by means of method, it is meditation. Since that entity abides there, it is established as its pervasion.🔽Since the assembly of causes that are the supported and the support occur, the result arises. Therefore, it is thought that it occurs in just that way here.

original: brten pa dang rten du rgyu tshogs pas 'bras bu 'byung ba de'i phyir 'dir yang de kho na bzhin 'byung ngam snyam na re zhig dam pa'i don la de mi snang ste /

translated: However, that does not appear in the ultimate.

original: sems rtogs na ye shes yin pas na sangs rgyas gzhan mi btsal ba'i 'du shes bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sems rtogs na ye shes yin pas na sangs rgyas gzhan mi btsal ba'i 'du shes bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Since the mind is pristine wisdom when realized, it is said that the discernment of not seeking buddhahood elsewhere should be cultivated.

original: de'i dngos po ni nyan thos pa dang / sems tsam pa dang / dbu ma pa la sogs pa'i lta ba dang bstun na yang sems tsam pa yin par shes pa kha cig ni yod par mngon pas na de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni nyan thos pa dang / sems tsam pa dang / dbu ma pa la sogs pa'i lta ba dang bstun na yang sems tsam pa yin par shes pa kha cig ni yod par mngon pas na de ni ma yin te /
translated: The thing itself is known to be Mind Only when compared with the views of the Sravakas, Cittamatrins, Madhyamikas, and so on.

original: sems rtogs na zhes pa ni don ni rtogs par bya ba'i ye shes ma sems de gang yang med pas na sems rtogs na zhes bshad pas bgegs pa'i na'am /
analyzed: sems rtogs na zhes pa ni don ni rtogs par bya ba'i ye shes ma sems de gang yang med pas na sems rtogs na zhes bshad pas bgegs pa'i na'am /
translated: Some say: If mind is realized, the meaning is that there is no mind at all that is a wisdom to be realized, and so it is explained as if mind is realized.

original: yang na sems rtogs na zhes pa ye shes la snang ba'i sems rtogs na de kho na ye shes yin pas na ye shes yin pa'o zhes 'chad pas na nyan thos la sogs par gnas pa med do //

translated: Or, if mind is realized means that if the mind appearing to wisdom is realized, it is just that wisdom, and so it is explained as it is wisdom, and so there is no abiding in the Sravaka and so on.

original: des na mdo sde las kyang /🔽sems nyid ye nas med pa la //
analyzed: des na mdo sde las kyang / sems nyid ye nas med pa la //
translated: Therefore, in the sutras it is also said:🔽The mind itself is primordially nonexistent.

original: de la rtogs pa'i blo mi 'jug / ma zhugs pa de de shes yin //
analyzed: de la rtogs pa'i blo mi 'jug / ma zhugs pa de de shes yin //
translated: The non-engaging mind is that wisdom.

original: de shes ye shes bla na med //
analyzed: de shes ye shes bla na med //
translated: That wisdom is unsurpassed.

original: ces gsungs pa yang snga ma'i khongs su 'gro'o //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yang snga ma'i khongs su 'gro'o //
translated: This also falls under the previous explanation.

original: dkon brtsegs las kyang /
analyzed: dkon brtsegs las kyang /
translated: The Heap of Jewels also says:

original: 'od srungs sems ni yongs su btsal nas mi rnyed do //
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni yongs su btsal nas mi rnyed do //
translated: Kāśyapa, when you search for the mind, you do not find it.

original: gang mi rnyed pa de mi dmigs pa yin pa'o //🔽gang mi dmigs pa de 'das pa 'am /🔽da ltar ram /
analyzed: gang mi rnyed pa de mi dmigs pa yin pa'o // gang mi dmigs pa de 'das pa 'am / da ltar ram /
translated: What is not found is not observed.🔽What is not observed does not exist in the past,

original: @177b ma 'ongs pa ma yin pas na //
analyzed: @177b ma 'ongs pa ma yin pas na //
translated: present, or future.

original: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //🔽yang sems gang gis yongs su rtogs pa de yang stong pa /
analyzed: zhes rgya cher gsungs so // yang sems gang gis yongs su rtogs pa de yang stong pa /
translated: Thus it is stated extensively.🔽Also, the mind that is fully understood is empty, and that full understanding is also empty.

original: yongs su rtogs pa de yang stong pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas na dngos po rtogs rgyu med pa zhes bshad /
analyzed: yongs su rtogs pa de yang stong pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas na dngos po rtogs rgyu med pa zhes bshad /
translated: Since it is said that there is no object to be understood,

original: de rtogs pa de la ye shes bla na med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de rtogs pa de la ye shes bla na med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: that understanding is called “unsurpassed wisdom.”

original: sangs rgyas gzhan nas btsal bya ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzhan nas btsal bya ma yin te /
translated: The Buddha is not to be sought elsewhere,

original: btsal bya yin na sems can tha dad pa'i skyon yang gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btsal bya yin na sems can tha dad pa'i skyon yang gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if he were, then the fault would arise that sentient beings are different.

original: de bas na gzhan btsal bya med ces bya ba rtogs pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na gzhan btsal bya med ces bya ba rtogs pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the Sūtra of the Realized One’s Inexpressible Intent says:

original: 'di tsam snang ba log pa la //
analyzed: 'di tsam snang ba log pa la //
translated: When this much appearance is reversed,

original: ye shes bla na med pa yin //
analyzed: ye shes bla na med pa yin //
translated: it is unsurpassed wisdom.

original: de phyir sangs rgyas sgra tsam zhig / gzhan du btsal la ma dngos 'dzin min //
analyzed: de phyir sangs rgyas sgra tsam zhig / gzhan du btsal la ma dngos 'dzin min //
translated: Therefore, the mere sound of Buddha is not to be sought elsewhere.

original: sgra la btsal bar bya min te //
analyzed: sgra la btsal bar bya min te //
translated: It is not to be sought in sound.

original: rtogs pa de nyid rang la yin //
analyzed: rtogs pa de nyid rang la yin //
translated: That realization is itself in oneself.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bas na rnam par rtogs pa goms pas gnas pas ma rtogs pa de la tha dad par rtogs pa ni mtha' gnyis ma spangs pa'i gang zag tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par rtogs pa goms pas gnas pas ma rtogs pa de la tha dad par rtogs pa ni mtha' gnyis ma spangs pa'i gang zag tu shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the person who has not realized that, who has a different realization due to the habit of conceptualization, has not abandoned the two extremes.

original: tshig gi go cha dang pos ni don snang ba'i rang bzhin la /
analyzed: tshig gi go cha dang pos ni don snang ba'i rang bzhin la /
translated: By the first armor of words, the nature of the appearance of the meaning is shown.

original: gnyis pas ni kun rdzob dang bstun no //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni kun rdzob dang bstun no //
translated: By the second, it is shown in accord with the conventional.

original: de'i 'og mas ni stong pa dang bstun la /
analyzed: de'i 'og mas ni stong pa dang bstun la /
translated: By the one after that, it is shown in accord with emptiness.

original: de'i 'og mas ni rnam par rtog pa dang bstun no //
analyzed: de'i 'og mas ni rnam par rtog pa dang bstun no //
translated: By the one after that, it is shown in accord with conceptualization.

original: de'i 'og mas ni mthar thug la gzung 'dzin la mi dmigs pas na sangs rgyas pa la dus dang snga phyi dang / che chung dang bzang ngan med de /
analyzed: de'i 'og mas ni mthar thug la gzung 'dzin la mi dmigs pas na sangs rgyas pa la dus dang snga phyi dang / che chung dang bzang ngan med de /
translated: By the one after that, it is shown in accord with the ultimate. Since there is no apprehension of subject and object, in Buddhahood there is no time, no earlier or later, no large or small, no good or bad.

original: dper na mar me mdzad dang da ltar gyi sems can tham la ba la yang khyad med par mnyam pa nyid du gnas pa yin no zhes ngo bo nyid la gnas pa'i don bshad pa yin zhes mkhas pa yan chad gsungs la /

translated: This is what the scholars say.🔽I have also given rise to a subtle thought about this.

translated: In the first chapter of the Secret Tantra, it says:

original: gang la chos nyid gnas pa de //

original: legs par rtogs dang de la mos //

original: de la cung zhig sbyin par bya //
analyzed: de la cung zhig sbyin par bya //

original: de las bzlog la de mi sbyin //
